label: 百姓
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Peasant, farmer, cultivator. A general term used from early times to designate the status of cultivating villager. In Muromachi times, a high-ranking hyakushō was called a myōshu. With the separation of warriors from peasants in the late sixteenth century, peasants were legally designated hyakushō.　[名主]
